Comments_List: Capacity to read unfamiliar texts in different ways; deeper understanding of inner diversity in Spinozas philosophy; developed seminar skills+sense of self as a member of the seminary.

Encouraged critical and free discussion of text. Allowed that discussion to be free flowing, but ensured always held to a standard of responsibility (both to the text and to fellow classmates). As such, encouraged both creativity in thought and mastery of material, overall empowering students.

Yes. The material is very worth knowing, and much different (as is often the case) to its popular presentation. Professor Levene is an exceptional discussion leader, and worth taking a course with irrespective of subject matter.
